N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 653.1 - Types of vehicles excluded

State Regulations

The following types of vehicles shall not be allowed upon the
bridges: (a) Dangerous or unsafe
vehicles which, in the judgment of the superintendent, are loaded, constructed
or operated in such a manner as likely to endanger persons or property, render
the use of the bridges unsafe, or unduly interfere with other
traffic. (b) Vehicles, which in the
opinion of the superintendent, are in charge of incompetent or intoxicated
operators. (c) Vehicles with
contents weighing more than 40,000 pounds, or more than 28,000 pounds on one
axle or with a wheel load exceeding 700 pounds per inch width of tire in
contact with the roadway, or being over eight feet in width, except by special
permission of the superintendent. (d) Self-propelled vehicles or trailers with
metal tires, except steam rollers without cleats. (e) Vehicles with inadequate brakes or
overloaded to such an extent that the means of propulsion are
insufficient. Notes
